trans-unit.target: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage using Python

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to list, upload and download blobs using the Python API.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to list, upload and download blobs using the Python API.

trans-unit.source: With the Python API provided in Azure SDK, you can
trans-unit.target: With the Python API provided in Azure SDK, you can

trans-unit.source: Create a container
trans-unit.target: Create a container

trans-unit.source: Upload a blob into a container
trans-unit.target: Upload a blob into a container

trans-unit.source: Download blobs
trans-unit.target: Download blobs

trans-unit.source: List the blobs in a container
trans-unit.target: List the blobs in a container

trans-unit.source: Delete a blob
trans-unit.target: Delete a blob

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the Python API, see [How to Use the Blob Storage Service from Python](../storage-python-how-to-use-blob-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the Python API, see [How to Use the Blob Storage Service from Python](../storage-python-how-to-use-blob-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: Guidance on technologies used to move data to and/or from Azure Blob storage are linked here:
trans-unit.target: Guidance on technologies used to move data to and/or from Azure Blob storage are linked here:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using VM that was set up with the scripts provided by [Data Science Virtual machines in Azure](machine-learning-data-science-virtual-machines.md), then AzCopy is already installed on the VM.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using VM that was set up with the scripts provided by [Data Science Virtual machines in Azure](machine-learning-data-science-virtual-machines.md), then AzCopy is already installed on the VM.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For a complete introduction to Azure blob storage, please refer to [Azure Blob Basics](../storage-dotnet-how-to-use-blobs.md) and [Azure Blob Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179376.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For a complete introduction to Azure blob storage, please refer to [Azure Blob Basics](../storage-dotnet-how-to-use-blobs.md) and [Azure Blob Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179376.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This document assumes that you have an Azure subscription, a storage account and the corresponding storage key for that account.
trans-unit.target: This document assumes that you have an Azure subscription, a storage account and the corresponding storage key for that account.

trans-unit.source: Before uploading/downloading data, you must know your Azure storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: Before uploading/downloading data, you must know your Azure storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: To set up an Azure subscription, see [Free one-month trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: To set up an Azure subscription, see [Free one-month trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: For instructions on creating a storage account and for getting account and key information, see [About Azure storage accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on creating a storage account and for getting account and key information, see [About Azure storage accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md).

trans-unit.source: Upload Data to Blob
trans-unit.target: Upload Data to Blob

trans-unit.source: Add the following snippet near the top of any Python code in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:
trans-unit.target: Add the following snippet near the top of any Python code in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:

trans-unit.source: The **BlobService** object lets you work with containers and blobs.
trans-unit.target: The **BlobService** object lets you work with containers and blobs.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a BlobService object using the storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a BlobService object using the storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: Replace account name and account key with your real account and key.
trans-unit.target: Replace account name and account key with your real account and key.

trans-unit.source: Use the following methods to upload data to a blob:
trans-unit.target: Use the following methods to upload data to a blob:

trans-unit.source: put\_block\_blob\_from\_path (uploads the contents of a file from the specified path)
trans-unit.target: put\_block\_blob\_from\_path (uploads the contents of a file from the specified path)

trans-unit.source: put\_block_blob\_from\_file (uploads the contents from an already opened file/stream)
trans-unit.target: put\_block_blob\_from\_file (uploads the contents from an already opened file/stream)

trans-unit.source: put\_block\_blob\_from\_bytes (uploads an array of bytes)
trans-unit.target: put\_block\_blob\_from\_bytes (uploads an array of bytes)

trans-unit.source: put\_block\_blob\_from\_text (uploads the specified text value using the specified encoding)
trans-unit.target: put\_block\_blob\_from\_text (uploads the specified text value using the specified encoding)

trans-unit.source: The following sample code downloads all blobs from a container.
trans-unit.target: The following sample code downloads all blobs from a container.

trans-unit.source: It uses list\_blobs to get the list of available blobs in the container and downloads them to a local directory.
trans-unit.target: It uses list\_blobs to get the list of available blobs in the container and downloads them to a local directory.
